basics.name: David Aizenberg
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software Engineer with a heavy focus on operations, hands-on approach and experience building robust and scalable systems

work.summary: Development of software using NodeJS and Python
highlights: Streamlining of deployment between environments using Docker containers
E2E Testing using pytest, tavern and selenium
Development of auxiliary utilities for support engineers, both CLI and Web based
Authentication, Authorization and Accounting, 802.1X, EAP & RADIUS
Performance and Security notifications, log collection and analysis
Docker based development and deployment
Isolated network Environments and encrypted tunnels between deployments
Incident response & Reduced functionality failsafe applications
Docker based CI/CD, Blue-green deployments, miscellaneous developer tooling and automation

work.summary: Development and support of various internal applications, management of a remote team
highlights: Introduction of modern software development practices into the team workflow [git, CI/CD, Testing, Developer Environments, PITR]
Troubleshooting and performance profiling
Single Source of Truth & Point of Entry API
Breaking up of a monolith application into lean micro-service based architecture
Speed up of time sensitive user interactions by utilizing message queues and stateless micro-services

work.summary: Development of Software as a Service product. Including choice of technology stack, platform, setting up infrastructure, and developing new features
highlights: Full Stack Development of SaaS product with MEAN Stack and Meteor framework
Code Reviews

work.summary: Deployment and maintenance of servers, personal computers and peripheral devices
highlights: Maintenance, updates and assistance with Linux, Windows and Mac OS X workstations
Deployment and maintenance of Linux Servers
Planing and implementation of security protocols, firewalls, private networks, configuration of network equipment
Component level electronics diagnostics and repair
